transportAdvice: Victoria is a compact and walkable city, with most major attractions, the Inner Harbour, and downtown easily covered on foot or by bicycle. A public bus network serves the broader city and surrounding areas, and taxis are generally available, though coverage is less extensive than in larger Canadian cities.

weather.description: Cool and frequently rainy with mild temperatures by Canadian standards, occasional frost but rarely snow.
Still wet and overcast but early signs of spring begin to appear, with slightly longer daylight hours.
Rain becomes less frequent and temperatures gradually warm, making it a pleasant early-spring destination.
Mild and increasingly sunny with blooming gardens, one of the most scenic months to visit.
Warm and largely dry with long daylight hours, ideal conditions for outdoor sightseeing and coastal walks.
Pleasantly warm and mostly sunny, marking the start of Victoria's reliably dry summer season.
The warmest and driest month of the year, with long sunny days and very little rainfall.
Continues the warm dry summer pattern, excellent for whale watching, cycling, and outdoor dining.
Warm and still largely dry, considered by many locals to be the best month to visit.
Autumn colours emerge and rain returns gradually, though many days remain clear and comfortable.
Noticeably wetter and cooler with frequent overcast skies, a quieter period for tourism.
Cool and rainy with short days, though the city takes on a festive atmosphere with holiday decorations.
